intro: Acer sinense, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in the autumn. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
